fields.System.Title: Customer Portal - Self-Service Account Management
fields.System.Description:
Feature Overview

Enable customers to manage their accounts independently through a self-service portal, reducing support ticket volume and improving customer satisfaction.

Background

Currently, customers must contact support for basic account changes like updating contact information, resetting passwords, or viewing billing history. This creates unnecessary support load and delays for customers.

Business Value

  • Reduce support ticket volume by an estimated 30%
  • Improve customer satisfaction scores
  • Decrease time-to-resolution for account-related issues
  • Enable 24/7 self-service capabilities
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Acceptance Criteria

  1. User Profile Management
    • Users can view their complete profile information
    • Users can edit contact details (email, phone, address)
    • Changes are validated in real-time
    • Email verification required for email changes
  2. Password Management
    • Users can change password with current password verification
    • Password reset via email with secure token (expires in 1 hour)
    • Password strength requirements enforced (min 12 chars, complexity rules)
    • Password history prevents reuse of last 5 passwords
  3. Billing & Payment
    • Users can view billing history for past 24 months
    • Users can download invoices as PDF
    • Users can update payment methods securely
    • PCI DSS compliance maintained
  4. Security & Notifications
    • Multi-factor authentication (MFA) can be enabled/disabled
    • Session management - view active sessions and revoke access
    • Email notifications for all account changes
    • Audit log of all profile modifications
  5. Performance & Quality
    • Page load time < 2 seconds for all views
    • Mobile responsive design (works on tablets and phones)
    • WCAG 2.1 Level AA accessibility compliance
    • 99.9% uptime SLA
fields.System.History: Feature created as part of Q4 2025 Customer Experience initiative. Aligned with strategic goal of reducing operational costs while improving customer satisfaction.

fields.System.Title: Advanced Search and Filtering - Product Catalog
fields.System.Description:
Feature Description

Implement comprehensive search and filtering capabilities for our product catalog to help customers find products quickly and improve conversion rates.

Current State

The current search only supports basic keyword matching. Customers report difficulty finding specific products, especially when browsing large categories.

Proposed Solution

Build an advanced search system with:

  • Full-text search with fuzzy matching
  • Faceted filtering (price, brand, ratings, availability)
  • Search suggestions and autocomplete
  • Recently viewed and popular items
  • Save search filters as presets

Success Metrics

  • Increase search-to-purchase conversion by 15%
  • Reduce average time to find product by 40%
  • Improve customer satisfaction score by 10 points
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Must Have (MVP)

  1. Search Functionality
    • Real-time search with debouncing (300ms)
    • Search across product name, description, SKU, and tags
    • Fuzzy matching for typos (Levenshtein distance <= 2)
    • Highlight search terms in results
  2. Filtering
    • Filter by price range (slider and manual input)
    • Filter by brand (multi-select checkbox)
    • Filter by customer rating (4+ stars, 3+ stars, etc.)
    • Filter by availability (In Stock, Out of Stock, Pre-order)
    • Filter by category and subcategory
    • Show result count for each filter option
  3. Sorting
    • Sort by relevance (default)
    • Sort by price (low to high, high to low)
    • Sort by newest first
    • Sort by customer rating
    • Sort by popularity (most purchased)

Nice to Have

  • Save filter combinations as presets
  • Search history for logged-in users
  • AI-powered product recommendations
  • Voice search capability

Non-Functional Requirements

  • Search response time < 500ms for 95th percentile
  • Support 1000 concurrent users
  • Maintain full functionality on mobile devices
  • Accessible keyboard navigation
fields.System.History: Approved in product planning meeting on 2025-09-15. Technical spike completed showing feasibility with Elasticsearch.

fields.System.Title: Inventory Management - Real-Time Stock Updates
fields.System.Description:
Feature: Real-Time Inventory Synchronization

Implement real-time inventory tracking and synchronization across all sales channels to prevent overselling and improve fulfillment accuracy.

Problem Statement

Current inventory system updates every 15 minutes, causing:

  • Overselling of popular items during flash sales
  • Customer disappointment and refunds
  • Inventory discrepancies between channels (web, mobile, in-store)
  • Manual reconciliation work for operations team

Proposed Solution

Build a real-time event-driven inventory system using message queues and WebSocket connections for live updates.

Technical Approach

  • Event-driven architecture with Apache Kafka
  • WebSocket connections for real-time UI updates
  • Optimistic locking with version control
  • Automatic reservation system (5-minute hold during checkout)
  • Multi-warehouse inventory allocation
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Core Requirements

  1. Real-Time Stock Updates
    • Stock levels update within 1 second across all channels
    • WebSocket push notifications to connected clients
    • Graceful degradation to polling if WebSocket fails
    • Show "X items left" when stock < 10
  2. Reservation System
    • Items reserved for 5 minutes when added to cart
    • Automatic release after timeout or checkout completion
    • Visual indicator showing "X in cart" for other users
    • Priority queue for abandoned cart items
  3. Multi-Warehouse Support
    • Allocate inventory from nearest warehouse
    • Automatic failover to backup warehouse if primary out of stock
    • Split orders across warehouses if needed
    • Show estimated delivery time based on warehouse location
  4. Overselling Prevention
    • Atomic decrement operations (database level)
    • Distributed locks for concurrent transactions
    • Stock reconciliation job (hourly verification)
    • Alert system for negative stock conditions
  5. Monitoring & Alerting
    • Real-time dashboard showing inventory status
    • Low stock alerts (threshold: 10% of average daily sales)
    • Out-of-stock notifications to merchandising team
    • Reorder point calculations and suggestions

Performance Requirements

  • Handle 10,000 concurrent inventory transactions/second
  • 99.99% accuracy for stock counts
  • Zero data loss during system failures
  • Complete inventory sync across all warehouses within 5 seconds
